item.title: The 2026 Super Bowl Ads (So Far), Ranked
item.description: Here is our critic’s survey of this year’s Super Bowl commercials, from best to worst to A.I.
item.dc:creator: Mike Hale
item.media:description: George Clooney pitches Grubhub in one of two Super Bowl ads directed by Yorgos Lanthimos.

item.title: This ‘Summer House’ Star Loves to Eat Like a Child
item.description: “Technically, I’m a toddler,” said Ciara Miller, who is back for the 10th season of the Bravo reality show. “Or I have the diet of one.”
item.dc:creator: Shivani Gonzalez

item.title: Savannah Guthrie’s Video Shows a Rare and Anguished Reality
item.description: Morning show hosts have shown a vulnerable, candid side to their audiences before, but not like this.
item.dc:creator: James Poniewozik

item.title: How Miss Piggy Went From Minor Muppet to TV’s Top Hog
item.description: Miss Piggy began as a bit player, but a sassy attitude and a karate chop carried her to the pinnacle of pop culture. A new Muppets special premieres on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Darryn King and Molly Matalon
item.media:credit: Molly Matalon for The New York Times

item.title: ‘The Pitt’ Season 2, Episode 5 Recap: Reunited
item.description: Robby and Langdon finally collide, and the vibe is predictably tense. That sabbatical can’t some soon enough.
item.dc:creator: Sean T. Collins
item.media:description: Dr. Robby and Dr. Langdon (Noah Wyle, left, and Patrick Ball) were thrown back together by a very scary case. Prognosis: touch-and-go.

item.title: ‘A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms’ Season 1, Episode 4 Recap: Is There No True Knight?
item.description: Ser Duncan faces a bigger test of his mettle than even he bargained for after assaulting a prince — about six extra knights’ worth.
item.dc:creator: Sean T. Collins
item.category: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms (TV Program)
item.media:description: Ser Duncan (Peter Claffey), still gazing heavenward.

item.title: Review: This Is Your Grandparents’ ‘Muppet Show,’ Fortunately
item.description: Nobody put too much thought into reinventing the gonzo variety classic for its revival. That’s what makes it a delight.
item.dc:creator: James Poniewozik

item.title: ‘Bridgerton’ Is Built on Romance. But Its Backbone Is Dance.
item.description: “There’s so much in the pomp and circumstance and the rules of the world that comes through dance,” said Tom Verica, a director of the Netflix series.
item.dc:creator: Stav Ziv

item.title: At a Charged Time for Jewish Culture, Stand-ups Confront the Moment
item.description: Not so fast. A new special from Raanan Hershberg shows how charged times can make for funnier jokes involving anxiety over Israel, Gaza and antisemitism.
item.dc:creator: Jason Zinoman
item.media:description: Raanan Hershberg in his new special, “Morbidly Jewish.”

item.title: Paul Thomas Anderson Wins Directors Guild Award for ‘One Battle After Another’
item.description: The filmmaker beat out Ryan Coogler, Guillermo del Toro, Josh Safdie and Chloé Zhao. The prize is a strong predictor of the Oscars.
item.dc:creator: Kyle Buchanan
item.media:description: Paul Thomas Anderson at the Directors Guild Awards on Saturday night.

item.title: At the Puppy Bowl, the Athletes Are Up for Adoption
item.description: Public service announcement: The players on the field at this annual Super Bowl Sunday event are all up for adoption.
item.dc:creator: Scott Cacciola

item.title: Timothy Busfield Is Indicted on Charges of Child Sexual Abuse
item.description: A grand jury in New Mexico heard allegations that Mr. Busfield, the actor and director, had sexual contact with a child actor. He has denied the charges.
item.dc:creator: Julia Jacobs
item.media:description: Prosecutors filed a criminal complaint against Timothy Busfield last month accusing him of sexual contact with a child. He has denied the charges.

item.title: 5 Children’s Movies to Stream Now
item.description: This month’s picks include the newest installment in a sci-fi saga for teenagers and a feature version of a beloved TV show for tots.
item.dc:creator: Dina Gachman

item.title: Late Night Finds Trump Out of Place at Prayer Breakfast
item.description: The annual National Prayer Breakfast “is supposed to be a normal, nonpartisan event,” Seth Meyers said, “but, of course, Donald Trump is incapable of being normal.”
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)
Late Night with Seth Meyers (TV Program)

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel Hints ‘Melania’ Box Office Was a ‘Rigged Outcome’
item.description: Late night hosts were skeptical of a $7 million opening weekend for the new Amazon film about the first lady.
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)
Late Night with Seth Meyers (TV Program)

item.title: One Episode of ‘Wonder Man’ Points a Way Forward for the Marvel Universe
item.description: Marvel’s character-driven show on Disney+ provides an intriguing alternative to the company’s big-screen spectacles.
item.dc:creator: Maya Phillips

item.title: ‘Bridgerton’ Tackles the Orgasm Gap
item.description: Sex therapists say a character’s struggle to reach her “pinnacle” could help viewers better understand women’s sexuality.
item.dc:creator: Catherine Pearson

item.title: ‘America’s Next Top Model’: Unhinged Moments That Helped Define the Show’s Legacy
item.description: A new documentary, “Reality Check: Inside America’s Next Top Model,” about the TV series from the 2000s aims to lift the veil on the show. These moments helped define its thorny legacy.
item.dc:creator: Remy Tumin

item.title: ‘Things Have Not Changed’: What ‘Heated Rivalry’ Gets Right About Men’s Sports
item.description: The show, about a romance between two closeted pro hockey players, is a surprise hit. But its popularity underscores how little has changed in the hypermasculine world of men’s professional sports.
item.dc:creator: Sopan Deb

item.title: Stellan Skarsgard on ‘Sentimental Value’ and His Wide-Ranging Career
item.description: After a stroke four years ago, the actor has changed how he approaches performances, including the one he’s become an awards favorite for.
item.dc:creator: Kyle Buchanan and Jason Nocito
item.media:credit: Jason Nocito for The New York Times

item.title: Harry Melling Went From PG ‘Harry Potter’ to B.D.S.M. ‘Pillion’
item.description: The actor Harry Melling shed his image as Harry’s cruel cousin, Dudley Dursley — and his clothes — to star in the queer romance “Pillion.”
item.dc:creator: Sarah Bahr
item.media:credit: Jono White for The New York Times
item.media:description: The British actor Harry Melling became known for a role in the “Harry Potter” movies. Now he stars in the kinky romantic comedy “Pillion.”

item.title: Michael Kosta Blasts the Super Bowl Halftime Alternative
item.description: “Man, that is a real who’s who of ‘Who?’” Kosta mused about Turning Point USA’s concert as opposed to the halftime show led by Bad Bunny.
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (TV Program)
Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)
Late Night with Seth Meyers (TV Program)

item.title: The Best Movies and TV Shows Coming to Netflix in February
item.description: A new series from the creator of “Derry Girls” and an inside look at the world of competitive ice dancing are among the highlights this month.
item.dc:creator: Noel Murray
item.media:description: From left, Caoilfhionn Dunne, Roisin Gallagher and Sinead Keenan in a scene from “How to Get to Heaven From Belfast.”

item.title: Sean Hayes Suffers Writer’s Block and More Horrors in ‘The Unknown’
item.description: In David Cale’s “The Unknown,” the actor plays 11 characters including a writer suffering the horrors of writer’s block and an unraveling mind.
item.dc:creator: Erik Piepenburg

item.title: Jon Stewart Can’t Believe Elon Musk’s Choice of Holiday Party Venue
item.description: “You’re asking if Jeff Epstein has got any parties planned on the island on Christmas Day?” Stewart asked on Monday’s “Daily Show.”
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (TV Program)
Late Night With Seth Meyers Podcast (Radio Program)
Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)

item.title: ‘Today’ Anchor Savannah Guthrie’s Mother Is Missing, Authorities Say
item.description: Savannah Guthrie’s mother, Nancy, 84, was last seen on Saturday at her home in Tucson, Ariz. A sheriff said that investigators were treating her disappearance as a crime.
item.dc:creator: Claire Moses and Christine Hauser
item.media:description: Savannah Guthrie and her mother, Nancy Guthrie, on the “Today” show set in 2023.

item.title: Trump Assails Grammys and Threatens to Sue Trevor Noah Over Epstein Joke
item.description: President Trump declared the awards ceremony “virtually unwatchable” and accused Mr. Noah of defamation over a joke he made that appeared to tie the president to Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: Matt Stevens
item.media:description: Trevor Noah onstage during the 68th Annual Grammy Awards in Los Angeles.

item.title: Super Bowl LX, Plus 6 Things on TV This Week
item.description: The Olympic Games in Milan and Cortina begin, and the Seattle Seahawks face the New England Patriots.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Gonzalez
item.media:description: Bad Bunny is set to perform at the 2026 Super Bowl.

item.title: ‘A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms’ Season 1, Episode 3 Recap: Waking the Dragon
item.description: Dunk makes a powerful new enemy. Egg makes his true self known.
item.dc:creator: Sean T. Collins
item.category: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms (TV Program)
item.media:description: Dunk has provoked the dragon, a.k.a., Prince Aerion (Finn Bennett), a capital B, capital G Bad Guy.

item.title: On ‘S.N.L.,’ Tom Homan’s Advice to ICE: ‘Don’t Get Filmed’
item.description: The “Saturday Night Live” alum Pete Davidson plays the border czar who was tasked with reorienting ICE agents in Minneapolis, replacing their ousted commander.
item.dc:creator: Dave Itzkoff

item.title: Best Movies and Shows Streaming in February 2026
item.description: The docuseries “Soul Power” and “The Muppet Show” arrive, and “Dark Winds,” “Monarch: Legacy of Monsters,” “Scrubs” and “John Oliver” return.
item.dc:creator: Noel Murray
item.category: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver (TV Program)
